summary: When the kingdom's most-wanted bandit, Flynn Rider (Zachary Levi), hides in a convenient tower, he immediately becomes a captive of Rapunzel (Mandy Moore), the spire's longtime resident. Crowned with 70 feet of magical golden hair, she has been locked away for years and desperately wants freedom. The feisty teenager strikes a deal with Flynn, and together they begin a whirlwind adventure.

reviews.content: A fun adventure movie that goes back to Disney's fairy tale roots. While not particularly unique, it's full of wholesome feel good moments that makes for a enjoyable time.
A fantastic movie.It's my favorite movie of all time ever since it came out.Rapunzel is my favorite Disney princess easily.The animation is also great.Highly recommend.
LOL, the funniest 01 hour: and 41 minutes ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Starring Mandy Moore as the voice of Rapunzel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

All white cast. No minorities. A classic dashing rogue woos the high class girl story. Villain is a childless hag. Rapunzel is traditionally feminine. Movie ends with them getting married. Tangled could *NOT* be pitched today at Disney.
This movie sucked. This is the best you could come up with? Maybe keep your next idea to yourself.

I would never hesitate to say this movie is one of my favorite films ever. It is a perfect adaptation of the Disney princess, Rapunzel. If you like to watch Little Mermaid, Aladin, and Snow white, you can never miss this!

I bet that one of the iconic things in Rapunzel that most people remember is an incredibly long-haired princess locked in a soaring tower. And since it is a fairytale, how can we forget about the witch and the prince? Tangled grasps that point well and makes the story more modern and lively. I love how Disney makes a pan as Rapunzel's defense weapon. It fits her character so much that I forget to feel sorry for Flynn, a poor bandit, who is welcomed by that samely pan right at their first meeting. After meeting with Flynn, Rapunzel starts to have an idea to sneak into where she saw the floating lights every year on her birthday. And that is how the story begins.

Even though the story is entertaining, it also contains many loopholes. One of them is Rapenzal's healing power. We can see that Disney seems to keep emphasizing that her power comes from her long golden hair. However, Rapunzel still can heal Flynn's fatal wound after her hair, which deem to be her source of healing power, is cut off. By the way, this curiosity does not affect the amusement we can get from the film.

The melody in each scene is also not memorable. Listening to it throughout the film is fine, but it is all forgotten once it ends. Compared to Frozen and Encanto, the songs in Tangled are too bland. It did not catch the ear. But the lyrics are well accommodating the story of the film.

The characters in tangled are also very outstanding in their personality. Rapunzel is a young beauty who is cheerful and energetic. Flinn is charming and a little bit flirty. Maximus, a horse that can always make a meme face, is my most adored character. He is a tenderhearted and silly horse. Yet he pretends to be unshakable and cool. He can make me smile numerous times when I watch this movie. And we cannot forget a lovely sidekick, Pascal, a wit and calm chameleon. He looks super cute when cuddling with Rapunzel. That also makes him my favorite character in this movie. Last but not least is Mother Gothel, a villainess mother who locks Rapunzel in the tower.

The CGI in this film also contributes a lot. It shows the brightness and youthfulness of the fairytale. The scene when the night sky is full of the lantern is the most eye-catching. I remember that hair is the most challenging part when creating an animation. However, Rapunzel's hair in this movie looks so natural and silky. It is super gorgeous when it shines underwater.

In conclusion, Rapunzel is a fascinating comedy movie that delivers humor, romance, and a little drama. This movie is for both children and adults. I recommend you all have a look!
perfect, a super well told tale and amazing plot and story development.

Such a captivating, animated masterpiece. The soundtrack and animation are beautiful, and the characters are memorable. Disney did a great job reimagining the story! Kids and adults alike will love this movie.

By far tangled is the greatest film I expected. Or I should say the 50th animated features speak to the entire world they're the best. Tangled is a visually stunning, thoroughly entertaining addition to the studio's classic animated canon. Also I do want to called out again "Rapunzel let down your hair" because I want to swing with her in long hair great movie to watch i want to see it all again on Disney+

I loved the movie. There were some great themes, great songs, and great characters, but the only problem I have with this film is that the plot is way too predictable. I could predict what was going to happen from the moment the movie started.

I love it! The tv show (tangled the series), ruined Rapunzel's character for me, unfortunately, and I can't seem to enjoy the movie like I used to, anymore. It's sad, but well. Visuals are still very good and the songs are amazing.
a movie that marked my childhood a lot i remember watching it a thousand times walt disney did a great job making this movie i was grateful.
One of the best Disney movies
Good movie. Well done and one the kids will love

loving tangled, at this point, is a defining character trait for me. so many school projects ive included or focused on tangled in ive talked and gone insane about it extensively over the years and just GODDDD i love it. 
rapunzel and eugene (HIS NAME IS EUGEENNNEEEE. anyone calling him flynn rider is on THIN ICE I COULD CRACK WITH MY SKULL) have such a beautiful story. showing us how powerful genuine and real human connection can be by sacrificing themselves for each other, being so willing and honestly desperate to do so in order to save the other??? after knowing each other for just a few DAYS???? the impact just Knowing each other had on their LIVES so strong that eugene, who's had to live a life as someone else selfishly in order to just Stay alive, would DIE for her (and DID die for her) so she would keep her freedom from gothel.. so she could experience the life she craves for and deserves..... and rapunzel, who finally learned the awful awful truth about gothel and how cruel and downright evil she can be, learned how shes been lied to her Whole Life, and yet STILL would sacrifice everything she has every Ounce of potential freedom to keep eugene from dying...........GODDDDDDDDDDD. and this continues in the show as well like LIKEEEEE. LIKE. and the meaning "you were my new dream" has for the both of them ESPECIALLY EUGENE IMO LIKE!??!??!???! theyre just so perfect theyre just so good....truly a god tier ship when u rly rly understand them... no one gets them like i do (joke)......
once more i have infodumped instead of giving a 'proper' review but im so right and correct that im just leaving it like this GO NEW DREAM!!!!!! god even their ship name is good..i love u 5ever new dream

a good spin on the classic tale.
the tower not only phyically trapped rapunzel but she was also mentally trapped as we see show conflicting feelings on leaving the tower.

We get to great example of emtional manipulation.
i like the small detail how much evil mother ages when she not rapunzel and when she with her.

Truly a modern Disney classic, from the plot and songs to the characters and even feel of the story.  The animation is excellent and really detailed, especially for a film several years old now.  The story is fast paced and interesting and the accompanying characters are fun.  Humor saves it from being a super serious animated film and balances the more emotional and dramatic elements of the story.

Being a Disney film, I felt that everyone from children to adults could enjoy them. In addition, the structure of the film was very easy to understand and designed to keep the audience from getting bored. 
If there was one problem, there was one scene that I honestly thought did not need to be included. But overall, I strongly thought it was a very enjoyable film.
One of the greatest animated movies of all time. The singing was beautiful and the songs even better.
should be an 100 not joking totally honest perfectly splendid would watch with kids

We normally don't like animated films but this one was actually really good. 
The film was a little childish and predictable but you can expect that from a Disney movie.
It was a pretty adventurous film, and had a lot of funny scenes. 
I'm fond of feel-good movies because they are heartwarming.
Overall we really enjoyed this movie.

This film is one of the most amazing ones I've ever seen. Normally I'm not fond of action films because too much is happening at one time but this movie kept me interested and had shocking plot twists, I really couldn't stop watching. On top of that the film is unpredictable and impressive stunts. I would recommend to watch it!
My favorite disney movie.
A super fun movie. Cool premise, but not much substance. Highly enjoyable nonetheless.

A fairy tale for the fairy tale lover, and the whole family... Tangled Ever After short sequel is hilariously good too, and so is Olaf's retelling of Tangled, which is about a close personal friend of his...

Tangled is one of the best movies I have ever seen -- surely the best Disney movie. The characters are lovable and develop in a satisfying and timely way, the songs are fun and catchy, it's packed with humor, and the animation is beautiful. It's a heartwarming and perfectly-casted adventure story that feels fun to watch each time.

I am a huge Disney and animation fan, and was really interested in seeing Tangled. For me Disney have so many classics under their wing, Beauty and the Beast, The Lion King, Sleeping Beauty, Snow White, Bambi, Pinocchio, The Little Mermaid and Aladdin especially. For over a decade, the past Disney films ranged from very enjoyable(Emperor's New Groove) to truly disappointing(Chicken Little)- The Hunchback of Notre Dame and Tarzan were the last ones to truly blow me away- until now.

While Tangled had me interested, I didn't like how the film was advertised. The trailer looked as though the film would be a Dreamworks knock-off, and I didn't think much of the title either. I needn't have worried, Tangled was wonderful and Disney's best film in a while(I know I said that about last year's Princess and the Frog, yes I actually liked that too, but after seeing Tangled I've changed my mind). The film is so much better than its advertising suggested, it is not a knock-off of Dreamworks and more importantly it not only has the Disney magic but it has something for both kids and adults.

What wowed me immediately about Tangled was the animation. It is simply gorgeous. The colours look beautiful, the backgrounds are stunning especially that surrounding Rapunzel's tower and the characters are very well modelled. The real revelations are with Rapunzel's hair, which is a masterstroke and also the floating lanterns, a scene of true beauty and very touching. Alan Menken's music was a surprise and in a good way. For me, this was his best score since The Hunchback of Notre Dame(that score is amazing), I was especially taken with the Kingdom Dance.

The songs are also not bad at all, they are not quite instant classics like Colours of the Wind, Beauty and the Beast, When You Wish Upon a Star, Heigh Ho, Part of Your World, Circle of Life, Hellfire, Under the Sea, Whole New World and Bells of Notre Dame are, but they are listenable with beautiful melodies and surprisingly decent lyrics. The best for me were the stunning I See the Light and the goosebump-inducing Mother Knows Best.

The writing is another strong asset. Tangled has some truly excellent writing, particularly with Flynn and Rapunzel, it is funny, witty and even touching. The storytelling is polished and is snappily paced, with the action sequences lively and the ending fitting well with the rest of the movie. When I saw the trailer I was expecting a story scattered with pop-culture references and almost laughter-free dialogue, but actually the storytelling does have a classic feel to it and some scenes like the aforementioned floating lanterns give the film its magic.

I also loved Tangled's characters. Rapunzel is one sassy heroine and is also someone young girls in particular can relate to. Flynn is a charming, dashing and charismatic hero too, and his interaction with Rapunzel alone gives Tangled its spark. Mother Gothel is another strong character, in her character you can see shades of both Lady Tremaine and Frollo, and on top of that she is a very intriguing villainess. Even more surprising were the comic relief characters. There have been animated films/Disney films where the comedy either works like a glove(Emperor's New Groove), is either hit or miss(I say this with a heavy heart, Hunchback of Notre Dame) or doesn't work at all(Chicken Little). Here the comedy works perfectly, hilarious without being too over-the-top. Pascal is both hilarious and cute and Maximus the horse is a sheer delight in everything he does.

The voice acting also adds a lot to the film. Mandy Moore is a perfect choice for Rapunzel, she has a pleasant speaking voice and a beautiful singing voice. I loved the charisma Zachary Levi brings to Flynn, his voice is one of the main reasons why Flynn is as likable as he is, while Donna Murphy is perfect as Mother Gothel.

In conclusion, this was a wonderful film and I recommend it heartily for both kids and adults. For Disney fans too, I think you will be delighted, if you want humour, adventure, beautiful animation, good music, classic storytelling, witty scripting and likable characters, Tangled is a perfect match. 10/10 Bethany Cox
